input_text.Prompt:
Qualcomm on Thursday launched three Snapdragon processors designed to bolster camera, video and gaming in smartphones. The company also rolled out the Snapdragon Wear 2100 system on a chip for new wearable devices.

The trio of Snapdragon chips include the 625, 435 and 425 and the aim is to support LTE, new connectivity standards like 802.11ac and the latest camera image sensors. There's also tools to connect to sensors as well as quick charging technology.

According to Qualcomm, the 625 is the highest end of the trio and supports latest LTE speed as well as high resolution cameras. The 425 is the entry level chip with the 435 falling in the middle.

Snapdragon Wear is a platform that aims to power the latest Android Wear watches and expand from there. Snapdragon Wear includes processor, software, support and reference designs to target everything from health trackers to fashion to mobile devices.

The Snapdragon Wear 2100 is 30 percent smaller than the Snapdragon 400 has 25 percent less power and enables more sensors.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: Qualcomm has launched three new Snapdragon processors for mobile phones, with the aim of improving camera, video and gaming capabilities. They include the 625, 435 and 425, with the latter being the entry level chip and the former the highest-end. Snapdragon Wear is a platform that powers Android Wear watches, and Snapdragon Wear 2100 is smaller than the Snapdragon 400 and uses less power.
input_text.Response B: Qualcomm has unveiled three new Snapdragon processors designed to improve the camera, video and gaming capabilities of smartphones. The 625, 435 and 425 chips are intended to support the latest LTE, new connectivity standards and the latest camera image sensors. The 625 is the highest-end chip and supports the latest LTE speed as well as high-resolution cameras. The 425 is the entry-level chip, and the 435 is in the middle. The Snapdragon Wear 2100 is a platform that aims to power the latest Android Wear watches and expand from there. It is smaller than the Snapdragon 400, uses less power and has more sensors.

input_meta.preamble_a: Respond using only short words and simple language, as if you were talking to a child.
input_meta.preamble_b: Respond using complex language, long words and technical terms, as if you are an expert.
